DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of iron depletion with phlebotomies on blood triglyceride concentration, in subjects with hypertriglyceridemia and iron overload, compared with a dietary intervention alone. All subjects in this study will follow dietary and lifestyle counseling in a period of 3 months. A randomized group will receive phlebotomies every 3 weeks in this period.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Therapeutic Phlebotomies on the Triglycerides Concentration in Patients With Hypertriglyceridemia and Hyperferritinemia
DOC.criteria: Hyperferritinemia: > 300µgr/L for male and >200µgr/L for female. Hypertriglyceridemia: > 200 mg/dL in two determinations after at least ten hours of fasting and lipidlowering diet. Contraindications for phlebotomy: poor venous access, previous intolerance (hypotension or apprehension), heart disease, anemia. Subjects suffering from acute or chronic disease, including liver disease, diabetes, cancer, kidney disease or uncontrolled thyroid disease. Elevated C reactive protein (CRP) as a parameter of inflammation (>10mg/L). Alcohol intake: over 30 gr. per day for men and 25 gr. per day for women. Lipid lowering drugs use.
